isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL AIR SUSPENSION WITH TAPERED LEAF SPRINGS - REMOVE AND INSTALL - SUSPENSION AIR SPRINGS

step1.para: When replacing air springs, use only approved International parts for vehicle.
Unload vehicle and block wheels to prevent vehicle from rolling. Support vehicle with floor stands.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

step1.para: Exhaust air from vehicle and suspension system. Exhaust air by:

note.para: Even if air spring has a leak and is deflated, the air must still be exhausted from system.

step2.para: Automatic control - height control valve - disconnect link at lower connection, then rotate control arm to exhaust (approximately 45 degrees down) position.
Disconnect air supply line from air spring.

step1.para: Install replacement air spring assembly and tighten fasteners to specified torque values. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Connect air line to air spring and install height control valve linkage at lower end.
Build vehicle system air pressure to governor cut-out pressure and use soap solution to check for leaks.
Check for proper ride height adjustment. Refer to RIDE HEIGHT ADJUSTMENT.
